post_text: Following a difficult financial year in 2016-2017, the district developed a fund balance recovery plan that was adopted by the Board in September of 2017. The 2016-2017 year ended with a deficit of $943,000 dollars. The administration‚Äôs plan set a goal to recover $770,000 dollars to the fund balance at the end of the 2018 fiscal year. Through increased enrollment, a property tax audit, fiscal conservatism, and calendar changes, I am pleased to announce that the district fund balance will be approximately $4.7 million, up from $3.6 million, resulting in an increase of just over $1.1 million. We exceeded our goal by $321,000. Congratulations to Beverly Bobo and the staff of Gilmer ISD!

Dear Parent:

A student at our school has been reported as having a type of meningitis. Meningitis is an uncommon illness that affects the spinal cord and the brain.

We have spoken with the Department of State Health Services, Region 4/5N, in Tyler concerning this matter. The type of meningitis that has been reported requires no additional public health intervention at this time.

Routine illness monitoring should be conducted by the parents or guardians. If you suspect your child is ill please follow up with your family physician.

While this is not a public health concern, it is still a great concern to the family. Please remember this student that he may recover quickly.
